title: Reorganize active docs into domain-agnostic structure
description:
Create domain-agnostic directory structure and move active documentation to appropriate categories. Uses neutral naming that works for software, research, knowledge work, and any project type.

## Rationale

JIT is not just for software development - it supports research projects, knowledge management, and general work tracking. Directory names should be domain-agnostic:
-  not  - works for experiments, analyses, drafts, features
-  not  - works for methodology, background, principles

## Acceptance Criteria

- Create directory structure:
  -  (permanent user-facing docs)
  -  (work-in-progress linked to active issues)
  -  (permanent reference material)
  -  (future plans)
- Move files to appropriate directories:
  - **guides/**: file-locking-usage.md, research-workflow-examples.md
  - **active/**: Keep currently linked active design docs
  - **reference/**: cli-and-mcp-strategy.md, web-ui-architecture.md, graph-filtering-architecture.md, json-schema-api.md, search-implementation.md
  - **vision/**: knowledge-management-vision.md, document-graph-implementation-plan.md, document-viewer-implementation-plan.md
- Update internal links in moved files
- Verify no broken links
